g.text: reﬂections are now measured at the backscattering detectors
and as a result the peak splitting from the multiple cubic
phases is clearly observed in the pattern. Data collected in the
same range at both beamline 11BMat APS and POWGEN at
SNS are shown in Fig. 9. This example highlights that very
small differences in lattice parameter can be detected at
POWGEN, which is sometimes critical for following phase
transitions and samples with mixtures of similar phases.
While total scattering is not the primary mission of this
instrument, the shortest usable wavelengths provide quality
data for PDF analysis. The extended
increased measurement counts offered by POWGEN’s
instrument upgrade have expanded opportunities for studies
of disordered crystalline materials. Fig. 10 displays POWGEN
PDF data collected for a 6.4 g sample of BaTiO
intensity guide setting. Data were transformed into real space
ferroelectric material is well known at room temperature to
possess local ordering that is rhombohedral in nature, while
the long-range PDFand average structures are consistent with
POWGEN: rebuild of a third-generation powder diffractometer
) Rietveld reﬁnement of 1.09 g of andradite grossular Ca
from Crowsnest Pass loaded in a 6 mm V can and measured for 2.6 h in
the sample changer using a center wavelength of 2.665 A
temperature. Light-green dots represent measured data, the black line is
the model ﬁt to the data and the olive line is the difference curve. Tick
marks show the locations of the expected Bragg peaks. (
high-resolution data collected at beamline 11BM at APS from the same

for a total measurement time of 2.5 h and generated
, respectively. Reﬁnement results are shown for (
= 4.12). Data are shown as circles, reﬁnement results are shown as
colored lines, and the difference curves are shown as solid green lines
offset below the data and ﬁts for clarity.
